title: Product of k Consecutive Integers
content: Defines m(m+1)(m+2)···(m+k-1), the product of k consecutive integers starting at m.

title: The Function t_k(n)
content: The least m ≥ 1 such that n divides the product of k consecutive integers starting at m.

title: t₂(p) for Primes
content: For prime p, t₂(p) = p - 1. This is because p | (p-1)·p but p does not divide m(m+1) for m < p-1.

title: Trivial Lower Bound
content: Σ_{n≤x} t₂(n) ≫ x²/log x. Follows from PNT: ~x/log x primes up to x, each contributing p-1 ~ p.

title: Erdős-Hall Upper Bound (1978)
content: Σ_{n≤x} t₂(n) ≪ (log log log x / log log x) x². This is stronger than Erdős's original o(x²) conjecture.

title: Erdős-Hall Conjecture
content: Σ_{n≤x} t₂(n) = o(x²/(log x)^c) for any c < log 2. This is stronger than what they proved and remains OPEN.

title: Hierarchy Conjecture
content: For k ≥ 2, is Σ_{n≤x} t_{k+1}(n) = o(Σ_{n≤x} t_k(n))? Asks whether larger k gives asymptotically smaller sums. OPEN.

title: Special Cases for Factorials
content: t_{n-1}(n!) = 2 and t_{n-2}(n!) ≪ n (sharp for n = 2^r). Shows structure in factorial divisibility.

title: Selfridge Result (n = 10)
content: The strict decrease property (t_k(n!) < t_{k-1}(n!) - 1 for all 1 ≤ k < n) holds for n = 10.

title: Problem Status Summary
content: PARTIALLY SOLVED: Erdős-Hall proved the triple-log bound. Two questions remain OPEN: (1) polynomial improvement to x²/(log x)^c for c < log 2, and (2) the hierarchy conjecture for Σ t_{k+1}(n) vs Σ t_k(n).
